techmeme.title: Q&A with Sam Altman on the path to OpenAI, its origin story, building a consumer tech company, ads, competition, hallucinations, regulation, and the AI outlook (Ben Thompson/Stratechery)
Trump eliminating the USAGM cut the budget of the Open Technology Fund, launched in 2012 to let 24M+ people living in repressive regimes access the internet (Pranshu Verma/Washington Post)
Temu-owner PDD reports Q4 revenue up 24% YoY to ~$15.3B, below est., and net income up 18% YoY to ~$3.8B, after intensifying domestic competition and US tariffs (Luz Ding/Bloomberg)
Huawei unveils the 6.3" Pura X, which folds to a square clamshell with a 3.5" display, its first flagship running HarmonyOS 5, launching in China for ~$1,036 (Bloomberg)
How Nvidia, SK Hynix, TSMC, and ASML, with a combined $4T+ market cap, dominate the AI supply chain, each having an 80% to 100% market share in their fields (Mark Bergen/Bloomberg)
